pros: -Career Progression -Opportunities for growth -Kind people- understanding and emphatic -London based location with an office in Oxford Street
cons: -Diversity could be better. More men need to be employed into the business. Very female dominated.

pros:
Flexibility re working arrangements. 
Excellent cause, Passionate colleagues
cons:
Lack of consistency and transparency re: salaries
Poor line management
Frequent structural / team reporting changes

review_title: Good place to work, but room for improvement
pros: Great mission, learning and development was there to train and support as needed, felt real ownership of my own projects. Took good care of wellbeing and were flexible to allow for family emergencies etc. Felt strong team feeling in regional teams.
cons: Poor comms, siloed working, relatively undemocratic and found that internal politics undermined team success. Success ended up being a bargaining chip between departments and where departments would fight over who gets to the spoils. Experienced 3 major consultations in 2 years which led to a huge amount of disruption, low morale - job descriptions changing and redundancies. Very top heavy management structure, which explains a lot of the above. Lack of progression opportunities. Too London centric, not strong enough voice in regions which left staff feeling undervalued and ignored by leadership.

pros:
Kind, Caring and Positive place to work 
Exciting and creative projects to work on
cons: Limited promotion opportunity to some areas

pros: Competent staff, good people, good benefits, central location, flexible with working from home
cons: Big pay difference between remote and office workees

job_title: Junior PR %26 Communications Executive in London, England

pros:

Cause good
cons:

Two rounds of redundancies since I started.

VERY poorly managed.

pros: Great immediate team, supportive atmosphere, learning culture
cons: Silo working, knee jerk decision making

pros: A nice & supportive environment, great team who are very motivated. Many go above & beyond for the cause, taking on challenges & fundraising in their own time. This is not due to obligation but because they are so committed to the work. There are good options for flexible & remote working which people value.
cons: Progression within teams can be limited. Quite a few layers of management which can sometimes hold up decisions. Can be a challenge to get robust monitoring information which limits some fundraising options.

pros: Teenage Cancer Trust is a warm and friendly place to work. Everyone is driven, seeking to achieve the mission of the charity to reach all young people affected by cancer.  There is a good team ethos.
cons: If you want to work for a charity I cannot see any downsides to working at Teenage Cancer Trust.

review_title: A little time out for a good cause
pros: Can specify what day and time is best for you to go fundraising.  Only a couple of hours so can be done even if you've got something else on that day.
cons: Better if more frequent than every few months or so

job_title: PR & Communications Executive in London, England
pros: Best part of Teenage Cancer Trust is the people you work with and the unique Royal Albert Hall shows
cons: Not much upward mobility in most teams
